@mom Peter, please come here..fr: Pierre, viens ici s'il te plaît.

After a few minutes, you find another cr.en: After a few minutes, you find another crossroad.
After a few minutes, you find another cr.fr: Après quelques minutes, tu arrives à un autre croisement.

You feel lost and see another crossroad..en: You feel lost and see another crossroad.
You feel lost and see another crossroad..fr: Tu te sens perdu et tu vois un autre croisement.

@peter Is it the street on the right? I'.en: Is it the street on the right? I'm not sure.
@peter Is it the street on the right? I'.fr: Est-ce que c'est la rue à droite ? Je ne suis pas sûr.

You reach the main square..fr: Tu arrives sur la place principale.

There are many people on the main square.en: There are many people on the main square.
There are many people on the main square.fr: Il y a beaucoup de monde sur la place principale.

A street musician is playing guitar on t.en: A street musician is playing guitar on the main square.
A street musician is playing guitar on t.fr: Un musicien de rue joue de la guitare sur la place principale.

On the main square, a group of tourists.en: On the main square, a group of tourists is taking photos of the old buildings.
On the main square, a group of tourists.fr: Sur la place principale, un groupe de touristes prend des photos des vieux bâtiments.

Your music teacher is still here..en: Your music teacher is still here.
Your music teacher is still here..fr: Ta prof de musique est toujours là.

It looks like you don't have enough mone.en: It looks like you don't have enough money.
It looks like you don't have enough mone.fr: On dirait que tu n'as pas assez d'argent.

So you are playing with your toys in you.en: So you are playing with your toys in your bedroom.
So you are playing with your toys in you.fr: Tu joues donc avec tes jouets dans ta chambre.

You play for a few more minutes..en: You play for a few more minutes.

You leave the bedroom and go to your mom.en: You leave the bedroom and go to your mom.
You leave the bedroom and go to your mom.fr: Tu quittes la chambre et tu vas voir ta mère.

@mom Can you please go shopping for dinn.en: Can you please go shopping for dinner?
@mom Can you please go shopping for dinn.fr: Peux-tu, s'il te plaît, aller faire les courses pour le dîner ?

@mom You'll find everything at the super.en: You'll find everything at the supermarket.

@mom Here are 17 coins, I think that sho.en: Here are 17 coins, I think that should be enough.
@mom Here are 17 coins, I think that sho.fr: Voici 17 pièces, je pense que ça va suffire.

@mom Oh, and we need bread too!.en: Oh, and we need bread too!
@mom Oh, and we need bread too!.fr: Oh, et il nous faut aussi du pain !

@peter Can I stay home?.fr: Est-ce que je peux rester à la maison ?

@mom No, it's important to have food for.en: No, it's important to have food for dinner. You can play later.
@mom No, it's important to have food for.fr: Non, c'est important d'avoir à manger pour le dîner, tu pourras jouer plus tard.

@peter How do I get to the supermarket?.en: How do I get to the supermarket?

@mom You'll find it at the end of the st.en: Go to the end of the street and turn right.
@mom You'll find it at the end of the st.fr: Va au bout de la rue et tourne à droite.

@mom It's on the main square..fr: Il se trouve sur la place principale.

@peter Can you repeat the shopping list?.en: Can you repeat the shopping list?
@peter Can you repeat the shopping list?.fr: Tu peux répéter la liste de courses ?

@mom Sure. We need three tomatoes, four.en: Sure. We need three tomatoes, four eggs, five apples, and bread.
@mom Sure. We need three tomatoes, four.fr: Bien sûr. Il nous faut trois tomates, quatre œufs, cinq pommes et du pain.

@peter Can I buy something for myself?.en: Can I buy something for myself?
@peter Can I buy something for myself?.fr: Je peux m'acheter quelque chose pour moi ?

@peter I'd like to get some chocolate or.en: I'd like to get some chocolate or maybe a pastry.
@peter I'd like to get some chocolate or.fr: Je voudrais du chocolat ou peut-être une pâtisserie.

@mom But first, please buy the food for.en: But first, please buy the food for dinner.
@mom But first, please buy the food for.fr: Mais d'abord, achète la nourriture pour le dîner.

It is sunny with a bit of wind..en: It is sunny with a bit of wind.
It is sunny with a bit of wind..fr: Il fait beau et il y a un peu de vent.

It's not that cold..fr: Il ne fait pas si froid que ça.

You see children playing in the park as.en: You see children playing in the park as you pass by.
You see children playing in the park as.fr: En passant, tu vois des enfants qui jouent dans le parc.

You walk down the street until the end..en: You walk down the street until the end.
You walk down the street until the end..fr: Tu marches jusqu'à la fin de la rue.

@peter Which way is it? I think I should.en: Which way is it? I think I should turn left now.
@peter Which way is it? I think I should.fr: C'est par où ? Je pense qu'il faut tourner à gauche maintenant.

You take the street on the left..en: You take the street on the left.
You take the street on the left..fr: Tu prends la rue à gauche.

You take the street on the right..en: You take the street on the right.
You take the street on the right..fr: Tu prends la rue à droite.

You decide to go back..fr: Tu décides de revenir sur tes pas.

You are afraid of getting lost..en: You are afraid of getting lost.
You are afraid of getting lost..fr: Tu as peur de te perdre.

But after a while, it starts to feel fam.en: But after a while, it starts to feel familiar.
But after a while, it starts to feel fam.fr: Mais au bout d'un moment, ça commence à te sembler familier.

@peter I still have some coins to spend..en: I still have some coins to spend.
@peter I still have some coins to spend..fr: J'ai encore quelques pièces à dépenser.

@employee Sorry, we're out of tomatoes..fr: Désolé, nous n'avons plus de tomates.

@employee But they should have tomatoes.en: But they should have tomatoes on the market.
@employee But they should have tomatoes.fr: Mais ils devraient avoir des tomates au marché.

@employee I don't know why everyone want.en: I don't know why everyone wants apples today.
@employee I don't know why everyone want.fr: Je ne sais pas pourquoi tout le monde veut des pommes aujourd'hui.

@employee Unfortunately, we don't have a.en: Unfortunately, we don't have any more.

@employee How many eggs do you want?.en: How many eggs do you want?

@employee Unfortunately, we don't have b.en: Unfortunately, we don't have bread anymore today.
@employee Unfortunately, we don't have b.fr: Malheureusement, nous n'avons plus de pain aujourd'hui.

@employee But there's a bakery nearby..fr: Mais il y a une boulangerie pas loin.

@peter Can I have a bottle of wine?.en: Can I have a bottle of wine?
@peter Can I have a bottle of wine?.fr: Je peux avoir une bouteille de vin ?

@employee Sorry, you're too young to buy.en: Sorry, you're too young to buy wine.
@employee Sorry, you're too young to buy.fr: Désolé, tu es trop jeune pour acheter du vin.

Sorry, this is a bakery, we don't sell a.en: Sorry, this is a bakery, we don't sell apples.
Sorry, this is a bakery, we don't sell a.fr: Désolé, c'est une boulangerie, nous ne vendons pas de pommes.

@peter I would like this bread, please..en: I would like this bread, please.
@peter I would like this bread, please..fr: Je voudrais ce pain, s'il vous plaît.

@seller How many tomatoes do you want?.en: How many tomatoes do you want?

Peter puts the tomatoes in his bag..en: Peter puts the tomatoes in his bag.
Peter puts the tomatoes in his bag..fr: Pierre met les tomates dans son sac.

@peter Can you help me? I really need ap.en: Can you help me? I really need apples.
@peter Can you help me? I really need ap.fr: Pouvez-vous m'aider ? J'ai vraiment besoin de pommes.

@teacher I'll trade you these apples for.en: I'll trade you these apples for some pears. Do you have any?
@teacher I'll trade you these apples for.fr: Je t'échange ces pommes contre des poires. Tu en as ?

@teacher Great, I love pears too! Here a.en: Great, I love pears too! Here are your apples.
@teacher Great, I love pears too! Here a.fr: Super, j'adore aussi les poires ! Voici tes pommes.

@teacher That's too bad. Maybe next time.en: That's too bad. Maybe next time.
@teacher That's too bad. Maybe next time.fr: C'est dommage, ce sera peut-être pour une prochaine fois.

You come back home. Your mom looks at yo.en: You come back home. Your mom looks at your groceries.
You come back home. Your mom looks at yo.fr: Tu rentres à la maison, ta mère vérifie tes courses.

@mom Let's see what you bought!.fr: Voyons ce que tu as acheté !

@mom Great, you have the apples! I'll ma.en: Great, you have the apples! I'll make an apple pie.
@mom Great, you have the apples! I'll ma.fr: Super, tu as les pommes, je vais faire la tarte aux pommes.

@mom No apples? Well, I can make a pear.en: No apples? Well, I can make a pear pie instead.
@mom No apples? Well, I can make a pear.fr: Pas de pommes ? Mais je peux faire une tarte aux poires à la place.

@mom No apples or pears? I can use the c.en: No apples or pears? I can use the chocolate to make a chocolate cake.
@mom No apples or pears? I can use the c.fr: Pas de pommes ou de poires ? Je vais utiliser le chocolat et faire un gâteau au chocolat.

@mom No fruit? So we won't have any dess.en: No fruit? So we won't have any dessert today.
@mom No fruit? So we won't have any dess.fr: Pas de fruits ? Nous n'aurons donc pas de dessert aujourd'hui.

@mom It looks like you forgot the eggs..en: It looks like you forgot the eggs.
@mom It looks like you forgot the eggs..fr: On dirait que tu as oublié les œufs.

@mom You didn't buy bread?.fr: Tu n'as pas acheté de pain ?

Excellent job! You have got everything o.en: Excellent job! You have got everything on the list!
Excellent job! You have got everything o.fr: Excellent travail ! Tu as tout ce qu'il faut sur la liste !

And you still had enough coins to buy so.en: And you still had enough coins to buy something you liked.
And you still had enough coins to buy so.fr: Et tu avais encore assez de pièces pour acheter quelque chose qui te plait.

@mom You did a great job, Peter. Thank y.en: You did a great job, Peter. Thank you!
@mom You did a great job, Peter. Thank y.fr: Tu as fait un excellent travail, Pierre, merci !

@mom After dinner, you can play with you.en: After dinner, you can play with your toys again.
@mom After dinner, you can play with you.fr: Après le dîner, tu pourras à nouveau jouer avec tes jouets.

Good work! You got most of the items..en: Good work! You got most of the items.
Good work! You got most of the items..fr: Bon travail, tu as récupéré la plupart des choses.

@mom It's not perfect, but you did well,.en: It's not perfect, but you did well, Peter. Thank you!
@mom It's not perfect, but you did well,.fr: Ce n'est pas parfait, mais tu as bien fait, Pierre. Merci !

@mom What are we going to have for dinne.en: What are we going to have for dinner?

@mom It's okay, Peter. I'm sure you'll d.en: It's okay, Peter. I'm sure you'll do better next time.
@mom It's okay, Peter. I'm sure you'll d.fr: Ce n'est pas grave, Pierre, je suis sûr que tu feras mieux la prochaine fois.

The supermarket is right in front of you.en: The supermarket is right in front of you.
The supermarket is right in front of you.fr: Le supermarché se trouve juste devant toi.

It's hard to find what you want..en: It's hard to find what you want.
It's hard to find what you want..fr: C'est difficile de trouver ce que tu veux.

An employee asks if you need help..en: An employee asks if you need help.
An employee asks if you need help..fr: Un employé te demande si tu as besoin d'aide.

She is holding a bag of apples..en: She is holding a bag of apples.
She is holding a bag of apples..fr: Elle tient un sac de pommes.

@teacher Hi Peter, what a surprise to se.en: Hi Peter, what a surprise to see you here!
@teacher Hi Peter, what a surprise to se.fr: Bonjour Pierre, quelle surprise de te voir ici !

@peter I am looking for the bread..en: I am looking for the bread.

Another crossroad? Where should you go?.en: Another crossroad? Where should you go?
Another crossroad? Where should you go?.fr: Un autre croisement ? Où faut-il aller ?

You approach the man who sells fruits an.en: You approach the man who sells fruits and vegetables.
You approach the man who sells fruits an.fr: Tu t'approches de l'homme qui vend des fruits et des légumes.

As you look around, you find your music.en: As you look around, you find your music teacher.
As you look around, you find your music.fr: En regardant autour de toi, tu trouves ta prof de musique.

She is listening to the guitar..en: She is listening to the guitar.

You are new to the village because your.en: You are new to the village because your family has just moved here.
You are new to the village because your.fr: Tu es nouveau dans le village car ta famille vient de déménager.

It is a bit cold outside today..en: It is a bit cold outside today.
It is a bit cold outside today..fr: Il fait un peu froid dehors aujourd'hui.

@mom Grandma is visiting us tonight, so.en: Grandma is visiting us tonight, so we need five apples to make her favorite apple pie.
@mom Grandma is visiting us tonight, so.fr: Mamie nous rend visite ce soir, il nous faut donc cinq pommes pour faire sa tarte aux pommes préférée.

@mom We also need three tomatoes and fou.en: We also need three tomatoes and four eggs for the dinner.
@mom We also need three tomatoes and fou.fr: Il nous faut aussi trois tomates et quatre œufs pour le dîner.

@mom Remember, we went there last week..en: Remember, we went there last week.
@mom Remember, we went there last week..fr: Souviens-toi, on y est allés la semaine dernière.

@mom If you have enough coins, you can b.en: If you have enough coins, you can buy something for yourself.
@mom If you have enough coins, you can b.fr: Si tu as assez de pièces, tu peux t'acheter quelque chose.

@baker Hello Peter, what would you like.en: Hello Peter, what would you like today?

@seller Sorry, we just sold the last app.en: Sorry, we just sold the last apples to that woman.
@seller Sorry, we just sold the last app.fr: Désolé, nous venons de vendre les dernières pommes à cette femme.

@peter Oh no, I have to find a solution!.en: Oh no, I have to find a solution!
@peter Oh no, I have to find a solution!.fr: Oh non, je dois trouver une solution !

@seller Maybe you can use pears instead?.en: Maybe you can use pears instead?
@seller Maybe you can use pears instead?.fr: Tu peux peut-être utiliser des poires à la place ?

@peter Can I get the pears, please?.en: Can I get the pears, please?
@peter Can I get the pears, please?.fr: Je peux avoir les poires, s'il vous plaît ?

You decide to go to the market..en: You decide to go to the market.

When you arrive near the fruits and vege.en: When you arrive near the fruits and vegetables, you recognize someone.
When you arrive near the fruits and vege.fr: Lorsque tu arrives près des fruits et légumes, tu reconnais quelqu'un.

@peter I'm buying food for dinner..fr: J'achète à manger pour le dîner.

@peter We'll make an apple pie for my Gr.en: We'll make an apple pie for my Grandma.
@peter We'll make an apple pie for my Gr.fr: Nous ferons une tarte aux pommes pour ma grand-mère.

@teacher Great! I love apples too. I'm g.en: Great! I love apples too. I'm going to make apple sauce.
@teacher Great! I love apples too. I'm g.fr: Super ! J'adore les pommes aussi, je vais faire de la compote de pommes.

@teacher See you later! I'll stay a bit.en: See you later! I'll stay a bit on the square to listen to the music.
@teacher See you later! I'll stay a bit.fr: À bientôt, je reste un peu sur la place pour écouter la musique.

But maybe you could have bought somethin.en: But maybe you could have bought something for yourself?
But maybe you could have bought somethin.fr: Mais tu aurais peut-être pu t'acheter quelque chose ?

@mom But first, let's make the apple pie.en: But first, let's make the apple pie!
@mom But first, let's make the apple pie.fr: Mais d'abord, préparons la tarte aux pommes !
